items.content_html: Minor follow up to #7956 , as discussed in https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/7956/files#r689338411
items.title: Intro to events - further encourage correct event handlers

items.content_html:
This change deletes the Web/Progressive_web_apps/Developer_guide page and redirects its sole Web/Progressive_web_apps/Developer_guide/Installing subpage to Web/Progressive_web_apps/Installing.

Rationale: The existing Web/Progressive_web_apps/Developer_guide page is almost entirely an in-article TODO list, with an outline of a structure for about a dozen subpages that nobody actually ended up creating â€” except for the Web/Progressive_web_apps/Developer_guide/Installing subpage, which has useful content. So we can preserve that content by promoting that page up to Web/Progressive_web_apps/Installing. Fixes #7977.
items.title: Drop never-finished Progressive_web_apps/Developer_guide doc

items.content_html:
Part 2 adds reference docs for the XRLightProbe object and XRWebGLBinding.getReflectionCubeMap()

I haven't documented events in a while, but I made pages for the event itself and the event handler property. Will follow-up with BCD later.
items.title: Add WebXR Lighting Estimation reference docs - pt 2

items.content_html:
This follows on from #7875 (part of documenting #7746).

Essentially the permission speaker-selection rolls out in FF92. This controls access to MediaDevices.selectAudioOutput(), which is undocumented on MDN. This adds docs so that the dependency can be added.

  • Still need to do BCD - am confirming the version it went into FF in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1577199#c22
  • Still need to add an experimental feature on this, because it is hidden behind media.setsinkid.enabled on Firefox.
  • May need to add glossary entry for transient activation required.
items.title: FF92 - MediaDevices.selectAudioOutput() docs

items.content_html:
This is part of fixing #3196 - replaces a page inclusion macro of the EffectTiming dictionary properties into the two places it is used: Element.animate(), KeyframeEffect()

I would like to update further, perhaps as a post process. To help with that, answers to the following would be great.

  1. There is also KeyframeEffectReadOnly() that redirects to KeyframeEffect() and a AnimationEffectReadOnly which we don't document. I can't see in spec but they do appear in https://docs1.w3cub.com/haxe~javascript/html/animationeffectreadonly/ . Is it "valid" or are these things that no longer really exist?
  2. The EffectTiming dictionary should be removed altogether but I'm not quite sure how to deal with it:
    • The properties have sub-docs which I presume I can pull in most of. That would be painful but is doable.
    • What concerns me is that the thing has its own BCD https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EffectTiming#properties that is not included in the Element.animate() compatibility. I presume the action here is to update that with each of these options?
items.title: Pagemacro: include rather than transclude EffectTiming properties

items.content_html:
Changed the Card expiry date format which was eariler in "mm/dd/yyyy" to "=MM/YY".

Fixes #2537.

items.content_html:
The replacement code for "Simplifying list selectors" can use an :if as the last selector instead of having a comma-separated list of complex selectors.

If it's felt that we should show the 3 separate selectors for clarity, then I would suggest adding <p>Or even...</p> followed by the sorter code example.
